docs.abstract: Lynch, James J: The Broken Heart. The Medical Consequences of Loneliness in America revd by H Jack Geiger
docs.lead_paragraph: WE have been led to believe, since Descartes, that our bodies are mere machines. After all, the final common pathways of disease and death are physical: plugged filters here, sludge in the tubes there, a leaking valve somewhere else. With electron microscopes, at a finer level of definition, we visualize crumbling slums of damaged cells, junkyards of wrecked molecules.
